tweets.text: We have Officers out in the North West installing temporary flood defences and clearing grids. Check your flood risk and keep up to date on the latest situation: https://t.co/FSRywjlIeM https://t.co/7oNomodTmU

üåß Cumbria: YELLOW Flood Warning

‚ö†Ô∏è The Met Office has issued a warning for heavy rain from 9am on Thurs 29 until midnight on Friday. More rain is expected on Sat & Sun

üëÇ Sign up for alerts at https://t.co/mLy4eH4Yxj

‚òéÔ∏è Floodline: 0345 988 1188 

üê• @EnvAgencyNW #floodaware
Great to see it all coming together https://t.co/S3tauTULdv

tweets.text: Heavy showers are expected across the North West this weekend and could lead to flooding in some communities. Check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn #beprepared https://t.co/p54kOPkzEk

tweets.text:
üéâ Beavers are back in #Cumbria! üéâ

We are delighted to share that a pair of Eurasian #Beavers have been introduced to an enclosed site on the private Lowther Estate. Find out more at: https://t.co/zn00Syw8qW

üìΩÔ∏è Camera trap footage @lowthercastle (Jim Bliss) #LakeDistrict https://t.co/RZLZonArBt

We've  teams out across the region inspecting our assets  preparing for the forecast of heavy rain. 

These photos are from Todmorden, Calderdale where we're bolstering our flood defences as a precaution.

Sign up to our free flood warning service  https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb
#Floods https://t.co/kwonQEXVFv

Work is well underway on Ponteland Flood Scheme with piling work taking place for the new flood wall. 

Here's Project Manager Kirsty Harwood explaining more about the project. 

Read more: https://t.co/D3qfBCWvio 

#flood #river
@EnvAgency @N_landCouncil @Morpeth_Herald https://t.co/L6bzIJ1D0T

tweets.text: We are going to see some wet weather over the weekend @EnvAgencyNW team are #prepared and you can take action as well #CheckRisk #SignUp #StayAware more info @TheFloodHub https://t.co/vm9R4Zna4s https://t.co/0oOPRwYLTJ

The forecast of rain today brings the risk of #flooding for the #NorthWest. 

Are you prepared?

Step 1. Check your flood risk https://t.co/e2TzH4KlsK (it takes less than a minute to check)

Step 2. Sign up for free flood warnings

Step 3. Keep up to date https://t.co/QG5hHwvkvB
Long-awaited works underway with @GroundControlGC and @EnvAgency to clean up river after Covid delays https://t.co/awAhSU4Q1X

Trying to predict flood risk for friends by rivers based on forecast rainfall and experience from Storms Ciara and Dennis in February this year.
